snippet: Restaurateurs are uncomfortable with a wave of mobile apps that secure and resell coveted tables at popular establishments, sometimes covertly.
abstract: Restaurant industry is engaged in debate over selling reservations for cash as variety of mobile applications, which secure and resell coveted tables at establishments, strive to become favored portal for people willing to pay premium to get into the best restaurants; app developers contend their services will bring more transparency and democracy to a system that is already rigged.
lead_paragraph: Restaurateurs are uncomfortable with a wave of mobile apps that secure and resell coveted tables at popular establishments, sometimes covertly.

headline.main: Getting a Good Table by Flicking an App, Not Greasing a Palm
headline.print_headline: Getting a Good Table by Flicking an App, Not Greasing a Palm
